repositories.brief_summary: OCaml 5.3.0 release and type system work with external types by Takafumi Saikawa
repositories.overall_activity:
- **OCaml 5.3.0 release** published by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) featuring deep effect handlers, restored MSVC port, and statistical memory profiling
- **Type system enhancement** with new `Type_external` kind by [Takafumi Saikawa](https://github.com/t6s) allowing abstract types with names ([#13712](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13712))
- **Runtime system refactoring** by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) distinguishing blocking and non-blocking mutex types to prevent deadlocks ([#13716](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13716))
- **Vectorizer improvements** including bug fixes for 128-bit constants and debugging enhancements through multiple commits
- **Documentation fixes** for Ephemeron module and Dynarray.for_all function through merged commits
repositories.ongoing_summary: Runtime mutex safety refactoring and type system enhancements for external type handling
repositories.ongoing_projects:
- **Runtime mutex safety** refactoring by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) to separate runtime and mutator mutex types, preventing lock inversion deadlocks ([#13716](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13716))
- **External type implementation** advancement with `Type_external` kind by [Takafumi Saikawa](https://github.com/t6s), enabling provable type equality and distinction for abstract types ([#13712](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13712))
repositories.priority_summary: Active discussion on runtime mutex API naming and safety in open PR
repositories.priority_items:
- **Mutex API naming** discussion in [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche)'s runtime PR with feedback from multiple reviewers on function naming conventions ([#13716](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13716))
- **Test failures** in atomic-locs/cmm.ml requiring investigation and promotion in the external types PR ([#13712](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13712))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on runtime system safety improvements and type system expressiveness
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Runtime safety emphasis** with careful distinction between blocking and non-blocking operations to prevent subtle deadlock scenarios
- **Type system expressiveness** improvements allowing better abstract type handling with external type names
- **Vectorization optimization** work continuing with multiple bug fixes and debugging improvements
repositories.contributors_summary: Key work by Takafumi Saikawa on type system and Gabriel Scherer on runtime safety
repositories.contributors:
- [Takafumi Saikawa](https://github.com/t6s): **Type system enhancement** with `Type_external` implementation for abstract type handling ([#13712](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13712))
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche): **Runtime mutex safety** refactoring to distinguish blocking and non-blocking mutex types ([#13716](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13716))
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron): **OCaml 5.3.0 release** management and publication with comprehensive feature set

repositories.brief_summary: Three new issues opened focusing on UI improvements and repository security
repositories.overall_activity:
- **UI enhancement** discussions initiated by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) addressing output formatting in `opam list` command ([#6356](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6356))
- **Validation improvements** proposed for better error handling of mistyped fields during package updates ([#6350](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6350))
- **Repository security** enhancement requested by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) for reproducible index.tar.gz generation ([#6349](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6349))
- **Documentation fix** merged addressing broken community repository link via PR [#6361](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6361) by [@juergenhoetzel](https://github.com/juergenhoetzel)
- **Testing infrastructure** improvements with Alpine and Gentoo depexts optimization commits
repositories.priority_summary: Three open issues requiring attention for user experience and security improvements
repositories.priority_items:
- **Output formatting** issue in `opam list` where column truncation lacks visual indicators ([#6356](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6356))
- **Error handling** improvement needed for mistyped opam file fields that should fail during update rather than being silently ignored ([#6350](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6350))
- **Reproducible builds** enhancement for index.tar.gz generation to improve security and verification ([#6349](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6349))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on user interface improvements and repository security enhancements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **User experience** improvements centered around better **visual feedback** for truncated output and clearer error messaging
- **Repository security** focus with emphasis on **reproducible builds** and verification capabilities
- **Development workflow** enhancements through testing infrastructure improvements for package managers on different distributions
repositories.contributors_summary: Kate leading UI improvements, Hannes Mehnert proposing security enhancements
repositories.contributors:
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) opened two **UI-focused issues** addressing output formatting and error handling improvements ([#6356](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6356), [#6350](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6350))
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) proposed **repository security** enhancement for reproducible index.tar.gz generation ([#6349](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6349))
- [@juergenhoetzel](https://github.com/juergenhoetzel) contributed **documentation fix** for broken community repository link merged via [#6361](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6361)

repositories.brief_summary: Major releases with experimental project-wide renaming and Merlin compatibility updates
repositories.overall_activity:
- Release of **version 1.22.0** featuring experimental project-wide renaming of identifiers by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) ([#1431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1431))
- Release of **version 1.21.0** with new server option `standardHover` for clients ([#1441](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1441))
- **Merlin compatibility** update for OCaml 5.3 preview support by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) ([#1386](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1386))
- **OCamlformat upgrade** to version 0.27.0 with extensive codebase formatting changes ([#1444](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1444))
- **Dependency maintenance** with multiple Dependabot PRs for TypeScript and SWC core updates ([#1442](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1442), [#1443](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1443), [#1440](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1440), [#1434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1434))
repositories.ongoing_summary: Project-wide renaming development and OCaml 5.3 compatibility work
repositories.ongoing_projects:
- **Experimental project-wide renaming** implementation based on preview Merlin work, enabling identifier renaming across entire OCaml projects including functors and signatures ([#1431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1431))
- **OCaml 5.3 compatibility** through updated dependencies and Merlin integration, requiring specific version pinning for build compatibility ([#1386](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1386))
- **Build system diagnostics** improvements for non-standard build directories like `_build_lsp` with workarounds using `DUNE_BUILD_DIR` environment variable ([#1433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1433))
repositories.priority_summary: Compilation error requiring Merlin 5.4-503 for master branch builds
repositories.priority_items:
- **Compilation error** with master branch when using OCaml 5.3.0 reported by [Sidharth Kshatriya](https://github.com/sidkshatriya), requiring Merlin 5.4-503 or pinning Merlin main ([#1445](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1445))
- **Package maintenance** request from [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) for adding `x-maintenance-intent` fields to opam files for repository archival process ([#1439](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1439))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on experimental features and toolchain compatibility maintenance
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Advanced IDE features** with the introduction of project-wide renaming capabilities that handle complex OCaml constructs like functors and signatures
- **Version compatibility management** with careful coordination between OCaml compiler versions, Merlin releases, and LSP server capabilities ([#1386](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1386), [#1445](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1445))
- **Build system flexibility** addressing developer workflow needs for non-standard build configurations and concurrent dune processes ([#1433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1433))
- **Ecosystem maintenance** with proactive package archival policy compliance and automated dependency updates ([#1439](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1439))
repositories.contributors_summary: Primary contributions from Ulysse with community feedback and dependency automation
repositories.contributors:
- [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos): Led major development work including project-wide renaming implementation, Merlin compatibility updates, release preparation, and OCamlformat upgrade ([#1431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1431), [#1386](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1386), [#1441](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1441), [#1444](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1444))
- [Sidharth Kshatriya](https://github.com/sidkshatriya): Reported compilation errors with OCaml 5.3.0 master branch builds ([#1445](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1445))
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm): Requested opam package maintenance compliance for repository archival process ([#1439](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1439))
- [Moritz Hamann](https://github.com/MoritzHamann): Provided feedback on build directory diagnostics issues with solutions ([#1433](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1433))
- [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto): Contributed OCamlformat upgrade attempt ([#1423](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1423))
- [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot): Automated dependency updates for development tools ([#1442](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1442), [#1443](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1443), [#1440](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1440), [#1434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1434))

repositories.brief_summary: Merlin 5.4-503 release with OCaml 5.3 support, project-wide renaming, and improved file location handling
repositories.overall_activity:
- **OCaml 5.3 support** completed with the release of Merlin **5.4-503** by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos), adding support for the latest compiler version ([#1880](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1880), [#1883](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1883))
- **Project-wide renaming functionality** implemented by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) using union-find structures to aggregate related declarations, enabling comprehensive renaming across entire codebases ([#1877](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1877))
- **File location improvements** by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) with enhanced handling of files with identical contents using path similarity heuristics ([#1882](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1882))
- **Stale occurrences reporting** enhanced by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) to flag potentially outdated references while still making them available to editors ([#1885](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1885))
- **Indexing performance** optimized by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) through reduced merge operations in the final index building process ([#1881](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1881))
repositories.ongoing_summary: Package maintenance policy discussions continue with opam repository archival requirements
repositories.ongoing_projects:
- **Package maintenance intent** discussions by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) and [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) regarding opam repository archival policies and x-maintenance-intent field specifications ([#1879](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1879))
- **Granular marshalling optimization** by [Charlène_Gros](https://github.com/Lucccyo) to improve ocaml-index performance through lazy loading, currently closed but represents ongoing performance improvement efforts ([#1875](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1875))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on OCaml 5.3 ecosystem compatibility and advanced IDE functionality development
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Modern OCaml version support** with completion of OCaml 5.3 compatibility work, demonstrating commitment to staying current with compiler releases ([#1880](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1880), [#1883](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1883))
- **Advanced IDE capabilities** through project-wide renaming and improved file disambiguation, enhancing developer productivity in large codebases ([#1877](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1877), [#1882](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1882))
- **Performance optimization focus** in indexing and marshalling operations to handle larger projects more efficiently ([#1881](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1881), [#1875](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1875))
- **Ecosystem maintenance** with active participation in opam repository governance and long-term package sustainability discussions ([#1879](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1879))
repositories.contributors_summary: Primary contributions from Ulysse and Liam Stevenson with ecosystem coordination by Hannes Mehnert
repositories.contributors:
- [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) led the **OCaml 5.3 upgrade** and **release management**, implementing project-wide renaming capabilities and indexing optimizations ([#1877](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1877), [#1880](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1880), [#1881](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1881), [#1883](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1883), [#1884](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1884))
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) contributed **locate functionality improvements** with file disambiguation and stale occurrence reporting enhancements ([#1882](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1882), [#1885](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1885))
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) initiated **package maintenance policy** discussions regarding opam repository archival requirements ([#1879](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1879))
- [Charlène_Gros](https://github.com/Lucccyo) worked on **performance optimization** efforts through granular marshalling improvements ([#1875](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1875))

repositories.brief_summary: Package management refactoring and SAT solver improvements by core maintainers
repositories.overall_activity:
- **Package management refactoring** by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) focused on code modernization and standardization ([#11282](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11282), [#11280](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11280), [#11279](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11279), [#11278](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11278), [#11255](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11255))
- **SAT solver improvements** including migration to `stdune` library and elimination of `failwith` calls for better error handling
- **Package dependency handling** enhancements by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) to prevent expansion of restricting dependencies
- **Automated benchmark tracking** with continuous integration updates for synthetic, Melange, and watch benchmarks
repositories.ongoing_summary: Code quality improvements and package management modernization continuing
repositories.ongoing_projects:
- **Stdune library migration** with systematic replacement of custom utilities with standardized library functions ([#11282](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11282), [#11280](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11280))
- **Package management system refactoring** including context renaming and opam library integration ([#11279](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11279), [#11278](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11278))
- **0install/opam integration cleanup** with inlining of shim components ([#11255](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11255))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on internal code quality and dependency management modernization
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Systematic refactoring approach** with [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) leading multiple coordinated improvements to package management internals
- **Error handling improvements** through elimination of `failwith` calls and better structured error propagation
- **Library consolidation** moving custom utilities to `stdune` for better maintainability and consistency
- **Enhanced testing infrastructure** with automated benchmark tracking across multiple build scenarios
repositories.contributors_summary: Core maintainer Rudi Grinberg with package dependency contributions from Stephen Sherratt
repositories.contributors:
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) led extensive **package management refactoring** with five merged PRs focusing on code modernization ([#11282](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11282), [#11280](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11280), [#11279](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11279), [#11278](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11278), [#11255](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11255))
- [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) contributed **package dependency optimization** to improve dependency resolution efficiency

repositories.brief_summary: Driver refactoring and operator parentheses fixes merged, plus maintenance metadata updates
repositories.overall_activity:
- **Driver architecture refactoring** by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) with code splitting and reorganization ([#1270](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1270), [#1271](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1271), [#1272](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1272))
- Fixed **operator parentheses** display in HTML output by [Jules Aguillon](https://github.com/Julow) for word-like operators ([#1268](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1268), [#1253](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1253))
- **Package maintenance** metadata request from [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) for opam repository archival process ([#1269](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1269))
repositories.ongoing_summary: Major Menhir parser integration work proceeding with multiple commits not yet merged
repositories.ongoing_projects:
- **Menhir parser integration** by [@faycarsons](https://github.com/faycarsons) with extensive work on light parsing, table handling, and location improvements visible in git commits but not yet merged into PRs
- **Driver module restructuring** continues with three-way split completed by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) ([#1270](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1270))
repositories.priority_summary: Fix for issue #1001 addresses documentation generation failures that previously caused catastrophic errors

- **Package maintenance intent** needs to be added to opam files for repository archival compliance ([#1269](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1269))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on parser improvements and code organization with multiple contributors working on different aspects
repositories.emerging_trends:

- **Output formatting consistency** fixes for operator display and HTML generation ([#1268](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1268))
repositories.contributors_summary: Jon Ludlam led driver refactoring while Jules Aguillon fixed operator display issues
repositories.contributors:

repositories.brief_summary: Release of OCaml 5.3.0 alongside multiple package releases and maintenance updates, including Merlin 5.4-503 and LSP 1.21.0-1.22.0
repositories.overall_activity:
- **OCaml 5.3.0** released by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) ([#27231](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27231)), marking the latest stable version of the OCaml compiler
- **Merlin toolchain updates** by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) with releases of Merlin 5.4-503 ([#27240](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27240)) and LSP protocol implementations 1.21.0 and 1.22.0 ([#27238](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27238), [#27244](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27244))
- **Package ecosystem maintenance** with multiple direct commits for package updates including linol 0.8 release, pcre 8.0.2 by Markus Mottl ([#27222](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27222)), and multicore-magic 2.3.1 ([#27247](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27247))
- **Deprecation and maintenance intent** additions by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) for several packages including git-cohttp variants ([#27223](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27223)), paf-le ([#27226](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27226)), and other packages ([#27211](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27211), [#27212](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27212), [#27213](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27213), [#27215](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27215))
- **Build system fixes** including Alpine 3.21 clang-format installation fix by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#27249](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27249)) and MCCS C++ compatibility update for macOS with OCaml 5.3 ([#27236](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27236))
repositories.ongoing_summary: OCaml ecosystem maintenance with compiler release integration and toolchain updates
repositories.ongoing_projects:
- **OCaml 5.3.0 integration** with ecosystem compatibility updates and dependency adjustments following the compiler release ([#27231](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27231))
- **Development toolchain evolution** with Merlin and LSP protocol updates supporting modern OCaml development workflows ([#27238](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27238), [#27240](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27240))
- **Package maintenance documentation** with systematic addition of x-maintenance-intent fields to packages by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) ([#27235](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27235)) and others to improve package maintainer visibility
repositories.priority_summary: OCaml 5.3.0 compatibility and deprecated package migration guidance needed
repositories.priority_items:
- **OCaml 5.3.0 compatibility** validation across the ecosystem following the compiler release to identify any breaking changes ([#27231](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27231))
- **Package deprecation handling** for git-cohttp variants and related packages deprecated by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm), requiring user migration guidance ([#27223](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27223), [#27226](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27226))
- **Build system compatibility** maintenance for cross-platform support, particularly macOS C++ compiler requirements with MCCS ([#27236](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27236))
repositories.trends_summary: Systematic package maintenance documentation and deprecation management across the ecosystem
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Maintenance intent documentation** trend with multiple contributors adding x-maintenance-intent fields to packages for clearer maintainer communication ([#27235](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27235), [#27243](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27243), [#27244](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27244), [#27245](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27245))
- **Active package deprecation** with systematic marking of outdated or redundant packages to guide users toward current alternatives ([#27211](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27211), [#27212](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27212), [#27213](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27213), [#27215](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27215), [#27223](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27223), [#27226](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27226), [#27229](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27229))
- **Development tooling consolidation** with coordinated releases of Merlin, LSP protocol implementations, and related editor support packages ([#27238](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27238), [#27240](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27240))
repositories.contributors_summary: Active week with contributions from OCaml core team members and ecosystem maintainers
repositories.contributors:
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) led the **OCaml 5.3.0 release** ([#27231](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27231))

- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) systematically **deprecated outdated packages** and added maintenance intent documentation ([#27211](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27211), [#27212](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27212), [#27213](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27213), [#27215](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27215), [#27223](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27223), [#27226](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27226))

- [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) contributed **maintenance intent documentation** for erratique packages ([#27235](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27235))

repositories.brief_summary: WASM optimization work and runtime architecture improvements
repositories.overall_activity:
- **WASM optimization** development by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) implementing direct calls to statically known functions ([#1790](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1790))
- **Runtime architecture** enhancement proposed by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) to split JSPI and CPS effect runtime components for better readability ([#1788](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1788))
- **Build system** modernization attempt by [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto) using dune-build-info for version management ([#1783](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1783))
repositories.ongoing_summary: WASM performance optimizations and runtime code organization improvements
repositories.ongoing_projects:
- **Double translation lambda lifting** optimizations being refined by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) to reduce unnecessary function lifting ([#1792](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1792))
- **WASM function call optimization** draft implementation exploring direct calls instead of closure indirection ([#1790](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1790))
- **Effect runtime refactoring** discussion about separating JSPI and CPS components into dedicated files with clearer naming ([#1788](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1788))
repositories.priority_summary: Runtime architecture decisions and WASM optimization approach need review
repositories.priority_items:
- **Runtime organization** decision needed on [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo)'s proposal to split effect.wat into separate JSPI and CPS files ([#1788](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1788))
- **Lambda lifting refinement** requires implementation of [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon)'s optimization to avoid lifting functions without free variables ([#1792](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1792))
- **WASM optimization approach** evaluation needed for draft PR that has conflicts and requires review decisions ([#1790](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1790))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on WASM performance improvements and runtime code organization
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **WASM performance focus** with direct function call optimizations and compilation strategy improvements ([#1790](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1790), [#1792](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1792))
- **Runtime architecture refinement** toward cleaner separation of concerns in effect handling systems ([#1788](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1788))
- **Build system modernization** attempts to leverage dune ecosystem tools for better version management ([#1783](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1783))
repositories.contributors_summary: Active development by core maintainers focusing on performance and architecture
repositories.contributors:
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon): WASM optimization implementation and lambda lifting improvements ([#1790](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1790), [#1792](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1792))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo): Runtime architecture enhancement proposals for effect handling ([#1788](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1788))
- [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto): Build system modernization work with dune-build-info integration ([#1783](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1783))

repositories.brief_summary: Backend refactoring planning with comprehensive implementation roadmap updated
repositories.overall_activity: - Comprehensive **backend refactoring** planning updated by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) with detailed roadmap covering register allocation, CFG optimization, and code generation improvements ([#2421](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/2421))
repositories.ongoing_summary: Major backend architecture overhaul with detailed implementation proposals across multiple compiler components
repositories.ongoing_projects:
- **Backend refactoring initiative** covering registers, instructions, CFG, register allocators, and code generation with specific implementation tasks outlined by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#2421](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/2421))
- **Register system redesign** to distinguish pseudo-registers from hardware registers and implement proper typing for register classes
- **CFG optimization** including critical edge identification, instruction caching, and dead code elimination
- **Register allocator improvements** with shared interval handling, priority queue extraction, and logging simplification
repositories.priority_summary: Backend refactoring issue needs discussion and approval before implementation can begin
repositories.priority_items: - **Backend refactoring proposal** requires team discussion and approval for comprehensive compiler improvements covering multiple subsystems ([#2421](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/2421))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on comprehensive compiler backend modernization and optimization
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Compiler infrastructure modernization** with emphasis on type safety, performance optimization, and code maintainability across register allocation and CFG handling ([#2421](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/2421))
- **Architecture simplification** through stateless modules, proper abstraction, and reduced code duplication in critical compiler components
repositories.contributors_summary: Xavier Clerc leading comprehensive backend architecture planning
repositories.contributors: - [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) updated comprehensive **backend refactoring roadmap** with detailed implementation proposals spanning register allocation, CFG optimization, and code generation ([#2421](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/2421))
